Description: Vue d'un temple de Thèbes à Loùqssor, one of two studies for Plate 49 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; a group of figures standing before the temple at Luxor with two boats (feluccas) on the river Nile at left, hills of Thebes beyond Pen and grey and brown ink, grey wash, squared for transfer
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Louis-Pierre Baltard for Denon's 'Voyage...' (there is no copy of the book the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12). Lit.: P. Rosenberg (ed.), exhib. cat., Paris, Musée du Louvre, 'Dominique-Vivant Denon: l'oeil de Napoléon', 1999, no. 103
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
